titles.title: A bill to reinstate and extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project in the State of Illinois.
A bill to reinstate and extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project in the State of Illinois.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Water and Power. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 108-15.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 108-22.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 37.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on January 28, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon licensee request, to: (1) reinstate the license for construction of a specified hydroelectric project in the State of Illinois; and (2) extend the time required to commence project construction for three consecutive two-year periods beyond the date that is four years after the date of issuance of the license.
